Name: WPF Test Tools
Description:
The *WPF Test Tools* release will include tools for testing your WPF applications.

Included in this release:
* [WPF Control Verifier] Version 0.1

You may also be interested in the [url:TestApi|http://www.codeplex.com/TestApi] library.  TestApi is an experimental library of test and utility APIs that enables developers and testers to test WPF applications, Windows Forms applications, .NET Framework applications, and Win32 applications. TestApi provides a set of simple, documented, componentized, and layered test APIs, which complement the [url:WPF Application Quality Guide|http://windowsclient.net/wpf/white-papers/wpf-app-quality-guide.aspx] and the materials available on the [url:WPF Testing blog|http://blogs.msdn.com/wpftesting].

Name: WPF Toolkit - June 2009 Release
Description:
!! What's new in the WPF Toolkit June 2009 Release?
* Chart Controls - Release notes and sample application available [url:here|http://blogs.msdn.com/delay/archive/2009/06/25/wpf-charting-it-s-official-june-2009-release-of-the-wpf-toolkit-is-now-available.aspx]
* Bug fixes for common issues, including:
** DataGrid.DeleteCommand requires a current cell (as reported [url:here|http://www.codeplex.com/wpf/WorkItem/View.aspx?WorkItemId=9259#])
** DataGridColumn DisplayIndex ArgumentOutOfRange exception (as reported [url:here|http://www.codeplex.com/wpf/WorkItem/View.aspx?WorkItemId=8266])
** DatePicker IsEnabled=False does not gray out (as reported [url:here|http://wpf.codeplex.com/WorkItem/View.aspx?WorkItemId=9641#])
** DatePicker Enter, Escape, and Spacebar inputs do not correctly commit/cancel edits and close the popup
** VSM steady state animations fail to run

Also new in the June release, we are introducing the concept of [Quality Bands] to rate the quality of the controls and features in the release.  
* *Components in the [Stable|Quality Bands] Quality Band*
** DataGrid
** DatePicker
** Calendar
** VisualStateManager
* *Components in the [Preview|Quality Bands] Quality Band*
** Chart Controls

!! Notes/Documentation
You may also be interested in the following resources:
* *[Tips & Tricks]* for using the WPF Toolkit components
* *[WPF Ribbon Preview]* download
* *[Links to Documentation]* including Beta MSDN Docs, walkthroughs, and hands on labs

*Note:* If after installing the June Update you encounter issues with the Toolkit controls in the Visual Studio Toolbox, please right-click on the Toolbox and select “Reset Toolbox.”

*Note:* The source code solution for the Chart Controls _design time_ will only build if you have both Expression Blend and Visual Studio (with the Visual Studio Designer for WPF) installed.  This is because the Chart controls are dependent on some design time assemblies included with those programs.  More info is available [url:here|http://blogs.msdn.com/delay/archive/2009/06/25/wpf-charting-it-s-official-june-2009-release-of-the-wpf-toolkit-is-now-available.aspx].

*Note:* If you have Visual Studio 2008, WPF Toolkit June 2009, and Blend 3 installed, and the WPF project in VS has a reference to System.Windows.Controls.DataVisualization.Toolkit.dll, you may get an error when opening your project. More info and workaround is [url:here|http://blogs.msdn.com/delay/archive/2010/01/19/sometimes-it-takes-a-village-to-solve-a-problem-workaround-for-a-visual-studio-2008-design-time-issue-with-the-wpf-toolkit-when-blend-3-is-installed.aspx].

!! Installation and Usage Instructions
Please note: The WPF Toolkit is dependent on [url:.NET Framework 3.5 SP1|http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=ab99342f-5d1a-413d-8319-81da479ab0d7&DisplayLang=en]. You must install .NET Framework 3.5 SP1 in order to use any features in the Toolkit.

*Instructions for using the WPF Toolkit binaries:*
# Install [url:.NET Framework 3.5 SP1|http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=ab99342f-5d1a-413d-8319-81da479ab0d7&DisplayLang=en]
# If you have a previous version of WPF Toolkit installed, uninstall it through the Remove Programs dialog on the Control Panel (look for "WPF Toolkit October 2008 (Version 3.5.31016.1)" or "WPF Toolkit January 2009 (Version 3.5.40128.1)" or "WPF Toolkit March 2009 (Version 3.5.40320.1)")
# Download the WPFToolkit{"_"}Binaries or WPFToolkit_BinariesAndSource
# Run the WPFToolkit.msi to install the WPFToolkit.dll and WPF Toolkit design time binaries to your Program Files folder
# Reference the binaries in your project:
## Reference WPFToolkit.dll in your project
## Add a using statement ("using Microsoft.Windows.Controls;") to the top of .cs files
## Add a new xmlns (for example, xmlns:toolkit="http://schemas.microsoft.com/wpf/2008/toolkit") to the top of XAML files
### Remember to use the namespace prefix (in the above example, <toolkit: ...>) in the body of your XAML

Name: WPF Futures
Description:
WPF Futures includes sample controls and features, many of which are being considered for the Toolkit.  

These samples are available as building blocks for more complete controls and will not be serviced regularly.

* *Client Profile Configuration Designer* - A designer to help you make custom branded installation experiences using the Client Profile.
** *May 2009 Release* includes stability improvements
** [url:Microsoft .NET Framework Client Profile Roadmap|http://windowsclient.net/wpf/wpf35/wpf-35sp1-start-here.aspx]
** [url:Client Profile Configuration Designer Overview|http://windowsclient.net/wpf/wpf35/wpf-35sp1-client-profile-config-overview.aspx]
** 4-part Client Profile Configuration Designer "How To" Series: [url:Configuring the UI (Part 1 of 4)|http://windowsclient.net/wpf/wpf35/wpf-35sp1-client-profile-config-part1.aspx]

* *Shader Effects BuildTask and Templates* - BuildTask and VS Templates that ease the building of GPU-shader based effects for use in WPF.  Unzip the file and read the readme.txt there for more information.  See [url:http://blogs.msdn.com/greg_schechter/archive/2008/08/11/a-visualstudio-buildtask-and-project-and-item-templates-for-writing-shadereffects.aspx] for more information.

* *Shader Effect BuildTask Source* - source code for the Shader Effect BuildTask.

* *WPF Splash Screen Item Templates for Visual Studio 2008 Sp1* - VS Item Templates that make it very easy to add SplashScreen to WPF applications in Visual Studio 2008 Sp1.  Requires .Net 3.5 Sp1 & VS 2008 Sp1. Simply install the MSI. Read the readme.txt as well as [url: http://blogs.msdn.com/jgoldb/archive/2008/08/12/what-s-new-in-wpf-3-5-sp1-splash-screen-to-improve-perceived-startup-perf.aspx] for more information.

* *WPF SplashScreen Template Setup Sources* - Source code for the Deployment project and templates.

* *Southridge Hands-on-Lab* - An extensive WPF Hands-on-Lab which teaches you how to build the Southridge Real Estate sample application.  Read more about the Southridge lab [here|Southridge Lab].

* *WPF Themes* - An updated collection of seven themes replaces the original nine WPF Themes. Some of the issues with the original themes have been addressed in this update. These Themes can also be found in the [url:Silverlight Toolkit|http://silverlight.codeplex.com/Wiki/View.aspx?title=Silverlight%20Toolkit%20Overview%20Part%203].  Check out the [WPF Themes] wiki page for a preview of each theme.

* *WPF Model-View-ViewModel Toolkit* - A toolkit intended to introduce the Model-View-ViewModel pattern. The release v0.1 of the toolkit includes a VS 2008 template, overview and walkthrough documents, as well as a more advanced Model-View-ViewModel sample. Learn more about the toolkit [here|WPF Model-View-ViewModel Toolkit].

Name: WPF Toolkit - March 2009 Release
Description:
*Attention:* As pointed out by users (thanks shallotx & Octothorpe!) the March 2009 release that was posted on Thursday evening was missing the DatePicker InEnabled=False fix.  We've deleted the old release and replaced it with this one, which contains new binaries.  See this [url:Discussion thread|http://wpf.codeplex.com/Thread/View.aspx?ThreadId=50825] for more information.

The WPF Toolkit is a collection of WPF features and components that are being made available outside of the normal .NET Framework ship cycle. The WPF Toolkit not only allows users to get new functionality more quickly, but allows an efficient means for giving feedback to the product team. Many of the features will be released with full source code as well. Over time, some of these features may be moved into the .NET Framework, based on readiness and customer feedback.

*This is the March 2009 Release of the WPF Toolkit.* The WPF Toolkit March 2009 Release includes:
* Fixes for top priority issues and frequent pain points, including:
** DataGridColumn * width designer crash issue
** Un-clickable popups in DataGrid RowDetails
** DatePicker crash when setting IsEnabled to False
** DatePicker SelectedDate binding is not TwoWay by default
** And many more!
* The same components as the January 2009 release, including:
** V1 of the WPF DataGrid 
** V1 of the DatePicker/Calendar 
** Preview of VisualStateManager (VSM)

*Note:* If after installing the March Update you encounter issues with the Toolkit controls in the Visual Studio Toolbox, please right-click on the Toolbox and select “Reset Toolbox.”

You may also be interested in the following resources:
* *[Tips & Tricks]* for using the WPF Toolkit components
* *[WPF Ribbon Preview]* download
* *[Links to Documentation]* including walkthroughs and hands on labs

Please note: The WPF Toolkit is dependent on [url:.NET Framework 3.5 SP1|http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=ab99342f-5d1a-413d-8319-81da479ab0d7&DisplayLang=en]. You must install .NET Framework 3.5 SP1 in order to use any features in the Toolkit.

Instructions for using the WPF Toolkit Preview binaries:
# Install [url:.NET Framework 3.5 SP1|http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=ab99342f-5d1a-413d-8319-81da479ab0d7&DisplayLang=en]
# If you have a previous version of WPF Toolkit installed, uninstall it through the Remove Programs dialog on the Control Panel (look for "WPF Toolkit October 2008 (Version 3.5.31016.1)" or "WPF Toolkit January 2009 (Version 3.5.40128.1)")
# Download the WPFToolkit{"_"}Binaries or WPFToolkit_BinariesAndSource
# Run the WPFToolkit.msi to install the WPFToolkit.dll and WPF Toolkit design time binaries to your Program Files folder
# Reference the binaries in your project:
## Reference WPFToolkit.dll in your project
## Add a using statement ("using Microsoft.Windows.Controls;") to the top of .cs files
## Add a new xmlns (for example, xmlns:toolkit="http://schemas.microsoft.com/wpf/2008/toolkit") to the top of XAML files
### Remember to use the namespace prefix (in the above example, <toolkit: ...>) in the body of your XAML

Name: WPF Toolkit - January 2009 Release
Description:
The WPF Toolkit is a collection of WPF features and components that are being made available outside of the normal .NET Framework ship cycle. The WPF Toolkit not only allows users to get new functionality more quickly, but allows an efficient means for giving feedback to the product team. Many of the features will be released with full source code as well. Over time, some of these features may be moved into the .NET Framework, based on readiness and customer feedback.

*This is the January 2009 Release of the WPF Toolkit.* The WPF Toolkit January 2009 Release includes:
* Fix for the VSM/DatePicker Memory Leak (see archived [url:Known Issue|http://www.codeplex.com/wpf/Wiki/View.aspx?title=VSM%20Memory%20Leak] page for more info)
* The same components as the October 2008 release, including:
** V1 of the WPF DataGrid 
** V1 of the DatePicker/Calendar 
** Preview of VisualStateManager (VSM)

You may also be interested in the following resources:
* *[Tips & Tricks]* for using the WPF Toolkit components
* *[WPF Ribbon Preview]* download
* DataGrid, DatePicker, & VSM documentation on [url:WindowsClient.net|http://windowsclient.net/wpf/], including:
** [url:DataGrid Feature Walkthrough|http://windowsclient.net/wpf/wpf35/wpf-35sp1-toolkit-datagrid-feature-walkthrough.aspx]
** [url:DatePicker & Calendar Feature Walkthrough|http://windowsclient.net/wpf/wpf35/wpf-35sp1-toolkit-calendar-datepicker-walkthrough.aspx]
** [url:Visual State Manager Overview|http://windowsclient.net/wpf/wpf35/wpf-35sp1-toolkit-visual-state-manager-overview.aspx]. 
** [url:Ribbon Feature Walkthrough|http://windowsclient.net/wpf/wpf35/wpf-35sp1-ribbon-walkthrough.aspx]
** [url:Hands-on-Lab: "What's coming in WPF: DataGrid, Ribbon, & VSM"|http://windowsclient.net/downloads/folders/hands-on-labs/entry76491.aspx]
** Six-part [Southridge Lab] with sample application featuring DataGrid and Ribbon.
** [url:Visual State Manager in Expression Blend|http://blogs.msdn.com/expression/archive/2008/10/30/blend-2-sp1-wpf-toolkit-visual-state-manager-for-wpf.aspx]. 

Please note: The WPF Toolkit is dependent on [url:.NET Framework 3.5 SP1|http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=ab99342f-5d1a-413d-8319-81da479ab0d7&DisplayLang=en]. You must install .NET Framework 3.5 SP1 in order to use any features in the Toolkit.

Instructions for using the WPF Toolkit Preview binaries:
# Install [url:.NET Framework 3.5 SP1|http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=ab99342f-5d1a-413d-8319-81da479ab0d7&DisplayLang=en]
# If you have a previous version of WPF Toolkit installed, uninstall it through the Remove Programs dialog on the Control Panel (look for "WPF Toolkit October 2008 (Version 3.5.31016.1)")
# Download the WPFToolkit{"_"}Binaries or WPFToolkit_BinariesAndSource
# Run the WPFToolkit.msi to install the WPFToolkit.dll and WPF Toolkit design time binaries to your Program Files folder
# Reference the binaries in your project:
## Reference WPFToolkit.dll in your project
## Add a using statement ("using Microsoft.Windows.Controls;") to the top of .cs files
## Add a new xmlns (for example, xmlns:toolkit="http://schemas.microsoft.com/wpf/2008/toolkit") to the top of XAML files
### Remember to use the namespace prefix (in the above example, <toolkit: ...>) in the body of your XAML

Name: WPF Toolkit - October 2008 Release
Description:
The WPF Toolkit is a collection of WPF features and components that are being made available outside of the normal .NET Framework ship cycle. The WPF Toolkit not only allows users to get new functionality more quickly, but allows an efficient means for giving feedback to the product team. Many of the features will be released with full source code as well. Over time, some of these features may be moved into the .NET Framework, based on readiness and customer feedback.

*This is the October 2008 Release of the WPF Toolkit.* The WPF Toolkit October 2008 Release includes:
* V1 of the WPF DataGrid 
* V1 of the DatePicker/Calendar 
* Preview of VisualStateManager (VSM)
The download link on this page includes only a runtime binary. You can browse or download the source code under the [url:Source Code|http://www.codeplex.com/wpf/SourceControl/ListDownloadableCommits.aspx] tab.

You may also be interested in the following resources:
* *[Tips & Tricks]* for using the WPF Toolkit components
* *[WPF Ribbon Preview]* download
* DataGrid, DatePicker, & VSM documentation on [url:WindowsClient.net|http://windowsclient.net/wpf/], including:
** [url:DataGrid Feature Walkthrough|http://windowsclient.net/wpf/wpf35/wpf-35sp1-toolkit-datagrid-feature-walkthrough.aspx]
** [url:DatePicker & Calendar Feature Walkthrough|http://windowsclient.net/wpf/wpf35/wpf-35sp1-toolkit-calendar-datepicker-walkthrough.aspx]
** [url:Visual State Manager Overview|http://windowsclient.net/wpf/wpf35/wpf-35sp1-toolkit-visual-state-manager-overview.aspx]. 
** [url:Ribbon Feature Walkthrough|http://windowsclient.net/wpf/wpf35/wpf-35sp1-ribbon-walkthrough.aspx]
** [url:Hands-on-Lab: "What's coming in WPF: DataGrid, Ribbon, & VSM"|http://windowsclient.net/downloads/folders/hands-on-labs/entry76491.aspx]
** Six-part [Southridge Lab] with sample application featuring DataGrid and Ribbon.
** [url:Visual State Manager in Expression Blend|http://blogs.msdn.com/expression/archive/2008/10/30/blend-2-sp1-wpf-toolkit-visual-state-manager-for-wpf.aspx]. 

Please note: The WPF Toolkit is dependent on [url:.NET Framework 3.5 SP1|http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=ab99342f-5d1a-413d-8319-81da479ab0d7&DisplayLang=en]. You must install .NET Framework 3.5 SP1 in order to use any features in the Toolkit.

Instructions for using the WPF Toolkit Preview binaries:
# Install [url:.NET Framework 3.5 SP1|http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=ab99342f-5d1a-413d-8319-81da479ab0d7&DisplayLang=en]
# Download the WPFToolkit_Binaries or WPFToolkit_BinariesAndSource
# Run the WPFToolkit.msi to install the WPFToolkit.dll and WPF Toolkit design time binaries to your Program Files folder
# Reference the binaries in your project:
## Reference WPFToolkit.dll in your project
## Add a using statement ("using Microsoft.Windows.Controls;") to the top of .cs files
## Add a new xmlns (for example, xmlns:toolkit="http://schemas.microsoft.com/wpf/2008/toolkit") to the top of XAML files
### Remember to use the namespace prefix (in the above example, <toolkit: ...>) in the body of your XAML

Name: WPF Toolkit - Preview
Description:
The WPF Toolkit is a collection of WPF features and components that are being made available outside of the normal .NET Framework ship cycle.  The WPF Toolkit not only allows users to get new functionality more quickly, but allows an efficient means for giving feedback to the product team.  Many of the features will be released with full source code as well.  Over time, some of these features may be moved into the .NET Framework, based on readiness and customer feedback.

This is a Community Tech Preview (CTP) Release of the DataGrid control.  The download links on this page include a binaries only and a binaries & sources release package.  You can also browse or download the source code under the [url:Source Code|http://www.codeplex.com/wpf/SourceControl/ListDownloadableCommits.aspx] tab.

Please note: The WPF Toolkit is dependent on [url:.NET Framework 3.5 SP1|http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=ab99342f-5d1a-413d-8319-81da479ab0d7&DisplayLang=en]. You must install .NET Framework 3.5 SP1 in order to use any features in the Toolkit.

Instructions for using the WPF Toolkit Preview binaries:
# Install [url:.NET Framework 3.5 SP1|http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=ab99342f-5d1a-413d-8319-81da479ab0d7&DisplayLang=en]
# Download and unzip the WPFToolkit_Binaries from the link above
# Reference the binaries in your project:
## Reference WPFToolkit.dll in your project
## Add a using statement ("using Microsoft.Windows.Controls;") to the top of .cs files
## Add a new xmlns (for example, xmlns:toolkit="http://schemas.microsoft.com/wpf/2008/toolkit") to the top of XAML files. Remember to use the namespace prefix (in the above example, <toolkit: ...>) in the body of your XAML.

Name: WPF Toolkit - February 2010 Release
Description:
!! What's new in the WPF Toolkit February 2010 Release?
* AutoCompleteBox
* Accordion
* Rating
* Bug fixes

!! Bug fixes for common issues, including:
*  DataGrid - Templating, multiple selection, runtime sorting, etc.
* Calendar/DatePicker - Styling, default values, focus related issues, etc.
* VSM - Generated transitions
* UI Automation - Mostly DataGrid UI automation fixes and a few for Calendar/DatePicker

Also new in the February release, we are introducing the concept of [Quality Bands] to rate the quality of the controls and features in the release.  
* *Components in the [Stable|Quality Bands] Quality Band*
** DataGrid
** DatePicker
** Calendar
** VisualStateManager

* *Components in the [Preview|Quality Bands] Quality Band*
** Chart Controls
** AutoCompleteBox
** Accordion
** Rating

!! Notes/Documentation

*The February release of the WPF Toolkit has been updated to contain symbols that match its binaries.*  We recommend downloading this latest package for an improved debugging experience.  This can be installed directly on top of your current installation of the February Toolkit by clicking ‘repair’ in the installer.

You may also be interested in the following resources:
* *[Tips & Tricks]* for using the WPF Toolkit components
* *[WPF Ribbon Preview]* download
* *[Links to Documentation]* including Beta MSDN Docs, walkthroughs, and hands on labs

*Note:* The source code solution for the Chart Controls _design time_ will only build if you have both Expression Blend and Visual Studio (with the Visual Studio Designer for WPF) installed.  This is because the Chart controls are dependent on some design time assemblies included with those programs.  More info is available [url:here|http://blogs.msdn.com/delay/archive/2009/06/25/wpf-charting-it-s-official-june-2009-release-of-the-wpf-toolkit-is-now-available.aspx].

!! Installation and Usage Instructions
Please note: The WPF Toolkit is dependent on [url:.NET Framework 3.5 SP1|http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=ab99342f-5d1a-413d-8319-81da479ab0d7&DisplayLang=en]. You must install .NET Framework 3.5 SP1 in order to use any features in the Toolkit.

*Instructions for using the WPF Toolkit binaries:*
# Install [url:.NET Framework 3.5 SP1|http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=ab99342f-5d1a-413d-8319-81da479ab0d7&DisplayLang=en]
# If you have a previous version of WPF Toolkit installed, uninstall it through the Remove Programs dialog on the Control Panel (look for "WPF Toolkit October 2008" or "WPF Toolkit January 2009" or "WPF Toolkit March 2009" or "WPF Toolkit June 2009")
# Download the WPFToolkit{"_"}Binaries or WPFToolkit_BinariesAndSource
# Run the WPFToolkit.msi to install the WPFToolkit.dll and WPF Toolkit design time binaries to your Program Files folder
# Reference the binaries in your project:
## Reference WPFToolkit.dll in your project
## Add a using statement ("using Microsoft.Windows.Controls;") to the top of .cs files
## Add a new xmlns (for example, xmlns:toolkit="http://schemas.microsoft.com/wpf/2008/toolkit") to the top of XAML files
### Remember to use the namespace prefix (in the above example, <toolkit: ...>) in the body of your XAML
